alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 2:31PM EST until February 27 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Hamilton County in southwestern Ohio... Southeastern Butler County in southwestern Ohio... Warren County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 230 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over North College Hill, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming and Cheviot. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 4 and 5, near mile marker 8, and between mile markers 11 and 42. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 12 and 19. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 2 and 32. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for southwestern and west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for southwestern and west central Ohio.
